docs.snippet: Law enforcement officials said that measures passed by conservative legislators could expose officers to greater danger and hinder investigations involving firearms....
docs.lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials said that measures passed by conservative legislators could expose officers to greater danger and hinder investigations involving firearms.
docs.abstract: Local police in more than dozen states are increasingly opposed to gun ownership rights and less restrictive gun laws; contend new laws put officers in greater peril and affect how safely investigations, particularly if weapon-involved crisis is unfolding, are carried out.

headline.main: As States Expand Gun Rights, the Police Object
headline.print_headline: States Widening Gun Rights Lose Longtime Ally: Police

byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Gulfport, and Timothy Williams from New York. Richard Fausset contributed reporting from Atlanta.
byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
